definitions.definition: To make something accessible or allow for passage by moving from a shut position.
definitions.example: Turn the doorknob to open the door.

definitions.definition: To make (an open space, etc.) by clearing away an obstacle or obstacles, in order to allow for passage, access, or visibility.
definitions.example: He opened a path through the undergrowth.

definitions.definition: To bring up, broach.
definitions.example: I don't want to open that subject.

definitions.definition: To enter upon, begin.
definitions.example: to open a case in court, or a meeting

definitions.definition: To spread; to expand into an open or loose position.
To make accessible to customers or clients.
definitions.example: I will open the shop an hour early tomorrow.

definitions.definition: To start (a campaign).
definitions.example: Vermont will open elk hunting season next week.

definitions.definition: To become open.
definitions.example: The door opened all by itself.

definitions.definition: To begin conducting business.
To begin a side's innings as one of the first two batsmen.
To bet before any other player has in a particular betting round in a game of poker.
definitions.example: After the first two players fold, Julie opens for $5.

definitions.definition: To reveal one's hand.
definitions.example: Jeff opens his hand revealing a straight flush.

definitions.definition: (of a file, document, etc.) To load into memory for viewing or editing.
To disclose; to reveal; to interpret; to explain.
An act or instance of making or becoming open.
definitions.example: He remembered fondly the Christmas morning opening of presents.

definitions.definition: Something that is open.
definitions.example: A salamander darted out of an opening in the rocks.

definitions.definition: An act or instance of beginning.
definitions.example: Their opening of the concert with Brass in Pocket always fires up the crowd.

definitions.definition: Something that is a beginning.
A vacant position, especially in an array.
definitions.example: Are there likely to be any openings on the Supreme Court in the next four years?

definitions.definition: An opportunity, as in a competitive activity.
In mathematical morphology, the dilation of the erosion of a set.
Pertaining to the start or beginning of a series of events.
definitions.example: The opening theme of Beethoven's Fifth Symphony is, perhaps, the most recognizable in all of European art music.

definitions.definition: Describing the first period of play, usually up to the fall of the first wicket; describing a batsman who opens the innings or a bowler who opens the attack
